name: Walter Afanasieff
description: '''Walter Afanasieff''' (born '''Vladimir Nikitich Afanasiev'''; {{langx|ru|Владимир Никитич Афанасьев}}, February 10, 1958), formerly nicknamed '''Baby Love''' in the 1980s, is an American record producer and songwriter. He was a frequent collaborator of [[Mariah Carey]] on her first six studio albums. Afanasieff and Carey co-wrote many songs together, including the number-one singles "[[Hero (Mariah Carey song)|Hero]]", "[[All I Want for Christmas Is You]]", "[[One Sweet Day]]", and "[[My All]]". He won the [[41st Annual Grammy Awards|1999 Grammy Award]] in the [[Grammy Award for Record of the Year|Record of the Year]] category for producing "[[My Heart Will Go On]]" by [[Celine Dion]], and the [[42nd Annual Grammy Awards|2000 Grammy Award]] for [[Grammy Award for Producer of the Year, Non-Classical|Producer of the Year, Non-Classical]].
